item.title: A multitude of dumped cars, 30th June
item.description:
This alleyway/dirt track/access road is completely blocked with dumped cars. Mostly untaxed, no mot and been left to rot for over 3 years. I have all the proof. I will be contacting trading standards as there is a mechanic who dumps the cars here and the environmental health department. These cars are dangerous, hazardous and are being left to rot.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Victoria Road, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge amount of rubbish dumped on Badgemore Path, 30th June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ancona Road, Plumstead, London

item.title: Sofa and other items flytipped, 30th June
item.description:
Yet another flytipping in this location. Hopefully we can find details down the back of the sofa. This spot is so regularly used, please can we have CCTV. I have asked so many times!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 31, Wagtail Way, St Paul's Cray, London

item.title: Drug taking and adult men loitering in children’s playground under slide, 30th June
item.description:
Drug dealing and adult mean loitering inside the wooden housing under the slide in what used to be Broadley Street Gardens. This is just outside the preschool nursery. Please put gates back and metal fencing, it may not cure this anti social behaviour but it could go to helping it. This area has become a litter accumulating, anti social haven since it was changed two years ago. Such a shame the council made the decision to change this once lovely gardens.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, Broadley Street, St. John's Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging tree - that needs ASAP resolution, 30th June
item.description:
There is an overhanging tree near the bridge & bus stop. It keeps getting hit by double-decker buses. If this is not resolved ASAP there is a real risk of serious injury to the public who may be hit by large overhanging branches.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beckenham Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet
